item.title: ARM CTF - Sending Bytes
item.description: Why hello there faithful reader! It's time again for another hacking related post. Today we'll be continuing on from our last post where we executed a buffer overflow to overwrite a secret number to reveal a flag. So, a quick recap: We have a buffer overflow for a service which accepts our input. We can send it anything we want, if we have some way to represent non-printable characters. We need to send it 129 bytes, with the first being 0x0 and the last being \n The program lives on a remote server that we can connect via an IPv4 address.
